result.execSummary:
The defendant Stuart M Fairchild was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Stuart M Fairchild in court with attorney Michael H. Kopp.  Jeffrey Alan Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel believes matters are resolved and requests disposition date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.

State by ADA Patti Wabitsch.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and with Atty Kopp.  Counsel waives reading & enters a not guilty plea.  Court finds probable cause.  State requesting $500 cash bail w/conditions including PBT vs SCRAM.   Counsel advises defendant turned self in on warrant.  Court orders $500 cash bail w/conditions:  Absolute sobriety; continue with SCRAM Bracelet; not to operate m/v w/out valid dl.  Court orders matter adj to 3/12 at 1:15 pm for further proceedings.
